basics.name: Dale V. Ross
basics.label: Software Engineer/Problem Solver
basics.summary: Dale currently resides in Orlando, Florida. He has earned a B. Sc. (Hons) degree from the University of West Indies, majoring in Computer Science and Electronics. While his work focuses on Software Engineering, primarily on the .NET Framework, his non-work interests span a wide range of areas including AI, Data Science, Machine Learning and Start Ups.

work.summary: Ross Squared aims to provide solutions to the hardest problems in the long term. In the short term Ross Squared will continue to connect people, devices and platforms to simplify life
highlights: Rebranded and migrated solutions to new parent organization
Provided free code tutoring sessions in-person and on slack. New platform to be decided.
Finalist in the Founder Institute, New York chapter
Built a winning team split between Orlando, USA, Jamaica and India
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, Python, Node.js, Azure, Digital Ocean, NGinx, MongoDB, MySQL, Git

work.summary: Started as a member of the Implementations Development team responsible for developing custom integrations for new clients being imported and eventually migrated to primary Integrations developer (internal)
highlights: Quickly became a dependable go-to guy after team reorganizations shortly after start
Participated in requirements gathering, discovery and development planning for new client onboarding

Developed and/or supported tools used for inbound/outbound feed management using C# based Windows Service with SQL Server backend and Desktop Interface for configuration (Logs were managed in MongoDB)
Investigated and resolved issues identified in existing feeds in internal tool built in C# and Jitterbit v4.0 and 8.0
Helped new team members to understand processes I had 'mastered', while at the same increasing my mastery
Kept team spirits high with a positive attitude towards problem solving
Helped to standardize authentication methods used by replacing legacy library with Auth0
Got tagged for improving integrations between internal systems through reducing redundancies and identifying other general opportunities for improvement
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, Linq, Azure, Auth0, JitterBit, MongoDB, MSSSQL, Git

work.summary: Dajen Group is a software solutions provider which aims to solve problems that affect a wide cross section of society
highlights: Built a chrome extension to add features to online word games
Built a score management system for an online scrabble league
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, PHP, Python, Node.js, Chrome Extensions, Azure, Digital Ocean, MongoDB, MySQL, Heroku, Google App Engine

work.summary: Member of start up team working to make the internet audible
highlights: Primary chrome extension developer, JavaScript guy
Circumvented CSP for media sources on medium to allow chrome extension to perform necessary functions
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Python, Chrome Extensions

work.summary: Member of small team of .NET developers working on products in the timeshare industry.
highlights: Analyzed existing applications to identify and resolve defects
Developed ASP.NET MVC application with Quartz.NET to automate data transfer and provide statistics
Performed enhancements to existing applications
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, Quartz.NET

work.summary: Worked primarily on maintenance team to extend or support leagacy system
highlights: Investigated and resolved issues with limited knowledge of complex crop insurance system
Resolved assigned tickets with a wide range of complexities
Quickly conformed to software practices used by team
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, VB.NET, Fluent Validation, MyBatis.NET, Moq, Ninject, MSSQL

work.summary: Accomplishments include extending or customizing multiple MSCRM environments, writing tools to support SalesLogix/Infor CRM deployments and developing custom applications. Infinity Info’s clients range from mid-sized to multinational Fortune 500 corporations
highlights: Wrote an application that integrated with multiple ads endpoints including Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Facebook and Bing Ads
Developed components of  a web based meeting management system for a company that pioneered the development of treatment for patients with rare diseases
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Sage SalesLogix, K2 Blackpearl, Scribe Insight and Online

work.summary: Outsourced to Stag Parkway, a leading provider of products and services to RV Dealers
highlights: Participated in the preparation of the initial project plans and discussions for a major client requested system upgrade
Resolved multiple issues client was experiencing in SSIS packages, ASP.NET MVC web applications and other technologies
Documented critical SSIS ETL packages in preparation for environment upgrade
Technologies/Services Used: HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, SSIS, TFS, ASP.NET MVC

work.summary: Primary activities included supporting/extending a 24/7 top up (airtime) transaction processing system for leading telecommunication companies.
highlights: Led a team of developers
During my tenure, profitability of the platform increased to such a degree that the system was sold by MC Systems to a third party company which continues to grow
Identified and resolved long standing issues in environment, thus increasing environment throughput and by extension system profitability
Used AT commands to request SIM numbers from SIM cards used in POS terminals to allow logistics team to better track their resources in the field
Developed jobs to automate the transfer of balances between merchant accounts across disparate systems based on sale history to reduce merchant complaints
Developed or modified applications to consolidate multiple top up environments thus increasing operational efficiency and allowing merchants to manage their accounts from a centralized system
Integrated multiple additional products into environment to augment core top up business
Participated as a key player in relocation of environment to new hosting site after sale
Deployed instances of the top up environment across the Caribbean
Technologies/Services Used: C, C++, VB6, ASP, ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, C#, SSIS, TFS, Git, MSSQL, SSRS, WCF, ASMX Web Services, VeriFone POS

education.institution: University of the West Indies, Mona
courses: CS11A - Introduction to Computer Science I
CS11B - Introduction to Computer Science II
CS20Q - Discrete Mathematics for Computer Scientists
CS21Q - Digital Logic and Computer Architectures
FD13A - Law, Governance, Economy and Society in the Caribbean
CS37Q - Logic, Computability and Complexity Theory

awards.title: Karl Robinson Award for Computer Science

references.name: Delton Phillips
references.reference: Many things could be said about this developer, one word that comes to mind is reliable, open and knowledgeable. As a technical lead, I relied heavily on Dale's recommendations and his ability to work through technical challenges. His pragmatic approach to problem solving coupled with his advanced knowledge of various technologies contributed significantly to the profitability of the company

references.name: Ryan Simons
references.reference: I worked with Dale for just under 4 years at Management Control Systems and I found him to be an exceptional colleague. Resourceful, dedicated to timelines and adept at finding creative solutions to issues faced, even outside of his preferred languages. In time, Dale became the person with whom I'd trade development ideas and game changing proof of concepts. His work speaks volumes.

references.name: Nathaniel Nation
references.reference: As it relates to mathematics, software engineering and analysis, just to name a few, Dale is the one. He is very good problem solver and can very quickly come up with solutions to open doors, break barriers and make anything a success.

references.name: Wayne Baker
references.reference: Working with Dale is one of my best experiences. Learning from him helped me to develope into a senior developer I am today. He is very focused and adapts quickly to new technologies. I am comfortable recommending his work to anyone that's interested.

references.name: Kay Möller
references.reference: I know Dale V Ross through our membership of an online Scrabble/word game group, and he has proved himself invaluable when it comes to the technical aspects of score-keeping, etc. When the official Scrabble site changed the format of the game recently, omitting key features, Dale designed an app to address these shortfalls, improving vastly on the original. I can thoroughly recommend Dale as someone who anticipates others’ needs before they are aware of them, and solves problems promptly and with a (virtual) smile.

references.name: Gean Martinez
references.reference: As a developer on my team, Dale worked on various complex projects and I was always very impressed with his ability to receive high level requirements and produce great results. Often times, I had no real requirements for him but a vision and he was able to deliver each time. His development skills span client side and server side components and he is a great Microsoft technologist. We worked on innovative solutions including a mobile-first asp.net MVC project utilizing the Telerik Kendo Framework. We also worked on creating a custom Single Sign On (SSO) solution which we implemented on an already built custom application. I appreciated his cool and calm demeanor which I found helpful when dealing with complex solutions.
